Package com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.builders

Class MPDAssetBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.builders.MPDAssetBuilder
  • public class MPDAssetBuilder
extends Object
    The MPDAssetBuilder is used to build the parameters for an MPD asset download. The build() method will then produce an MPDAssetBuilder.MPDAssetParams which can be passed to IAssetManager.createMPDSegmentedAsset(MPDAssetBuilder.MPDAssetParams) or IAssetManager.createMPDSegmentedAssetAsync(MPDAssetBuilder.MPDAssetParams) to create a new asset.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  MPDAssetBuilder.MPDAssetParams
      This class contains the parameters to configure an MPD asset for download.
      static class  MPDAssetBuilder.MPDAssetParamsException
      An exception which is thrown on failed validation of fields during building of the asset params from the MPDAssetBuilder.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      MPDAssetBuilder()
      Create an MPEG DASH builder to begin configuring a new DASH asset for download or fastplay.
      MPDAssetBuilder​(MPDAssetBuilder.MPDAssetParams src)
      Create an MPD builder from existing MPD params.

        public MPDAssetBuilder​(MPDAssetBuilder.MPDAssetParams src)
        Create an MPD builder from existing MPD params. Does not copy ancillary files from the source parameters
        Parameters:
        src - MPD parameters used to initialize the builder.

      • assetId

        public MPDAssetBuilder assetId​(String val)
        Set the assetID.
        Parameters:
        val - Caller-provided ID that Virtuoso should assign to the asset, will be considered as unique for business logic rules. See IAssetManager summary for more details.
        Returns:
        The asset builder for chaining.

        Parameters:
        val - The asset URL
        Returns:
        The asset builder for chaining.

      • desiredVideoBitrate

        public MPDAssetBuilder desiredVideoBitrate​(int val)
        Set the desired video bitrate for this asset. Virtuoso uses the closest bitrate, which does not exceed this one, when generating from a playlist. A value of 1 means "use the lowest bitrate." If there's no profile of lower bitrate than aDesiredBitRate, Virtuoso will select the lowest bitrate profile. A value of Integer.MAX_VALUE means "use the highest bitrate."
        Parameters:
        val - The desired bitrate
        Returns:
        The asset builder for chaining.

      • desiredAudioBitrate

        public MPDAssetBuilder desiredAudioBitrate​(int val)
        Set the desired audio bitrate for this asset. Virtuoso uses the closest audio bitrate, which does not exceed this one, when generating from a playlist. If all available bitrates exceed this value then the lowest bit rate is chosen. The value must be between 1 and Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        Parameters:
        val - The desired bitrate
        Returns:
        The asset builder for chaining.

      • withResolutionFilter

        public MPDAssetBuilder withResolutionFilter​(Set<String> resolutions)
                                     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Set resolution filters to be applied when selecting video tracks for this manifest. Multiple filter values may be set and if multiple tracks match then the bandwidth rules will be applied. Resolution filters are defined as strings of the form "<width>x<height>"
        Parameters:
        resolutions - A list of strings containing resolution filters for the video track.
        Returns:
        The asset builder for chaining.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException
        See Also:
        desiredVideoBitrate(int)

      • assetObserver

        public MPDAssetBuilder assetObserver​(ISegmentedAssetFromParserObserver val)
        Set an observer to be notified when the asset has been generated. This observer has callbacks for parsing segments, parsing complete, and adding to the queue.
        Parameters:
        val - Observer to be notified when the asset has been generated.
        Returns:
        The asset builder for chaining.

      • withMetadata

        public MPDAssetBuilder withMetadata​(String val)
        Set metadata that should be associated with the asset. Typically a JSON string.
        Parameters:
        val - The metadata string which should be stored for the asset.
        Returns:
        The asset builder for chaining.

      • withPermissionObserver

        public MPDAssetBuilder withPermissionObserver​(IQueue.IQueuedAssetPermissionObserver val)
        Set a permission observer to be notified of the result of permission checks which will be made during queuing the asset. Adding this observer will force the SDK to perform a permission check during the queuing process. If the observer is not present then the permissions will only be checked at queue time if other conditions are met such as Request on queue backplane settings.
        Parameters:
        val - The observer to be notified of any permission checks when added.
        Returns:
        The asset builder for chaining.

      • addToQueue

        public MPDAssetBuilder addToQueue​(boolean val)
        Indicate if virtuoso should automatically add the asset to the download queue upon creation.
        Parameters:
        val - If true, Virtuoso will automatically add the asset to the download queue.
        Returns:
        The asset builder for chaining.

      • withPlaylistName

        public MPDAssetBuilder withPlaylistName​(String val)

        Set ancillary files that should be added to the asset and downloaded alongside the asset content.
        Parameters:
        list - The list of files to add with this asset.
        Returns:
        The asset builder for chaining.
        See Also:
        AncillaryFile

      • usesFastPlay

        public MPDAssetBuilder usesFastPlay​(boolean useFastPlay)
        Set if this asset should support fastplay. If set then this asset will be setup for fastplay regardless of if it is queued for download. Fastplay downloads do not report progress using the same observers as queued assets, instead they download silently. The queue observers will be notified of an update upon completion and the asset will be marked as fastplay ready, which can be checked with IAsset.fastPlayReady().
        Parameters:
        useFastPlay - true to use fastplay for the asset. Default is false.
        Returns:
        The asset builder for chaining.

      • setClientSideAdSupport

        public MPDAssetBuilder setClientSideAdSupport​(boolean showAds)
        Set if this asset should support client side advertising. If set then this asset will check for an advertising document URI from an IVirtuosoAdUrlResolver where available during parsing.
        Parameters:
        showAds - true to check for adverts during parsing
        Returns:
        The asset build for chaining.

      • withExpireAfterDownload

        public MPDAssetBuilder withExpireAfterDownload​(long expireAfterDownloadSeconds)
        Set the expiration time for this asset to be the specified number of seconds after the asset has completed downloading.
        Parameters:
        expireAfterDownloadSeconds - number of seconds post download after which the asset will expire.
        Returns:
        The asset builder for chaining.
        See Also:
        IAsset.setEad(long)

        Parameters:
        expireAfterDownloadSeconds - number of seconds post download after which the asset will expire.
        Returns:
        The asset builder for chaining.
        See Also:
